intro: Diplotaxis vinealis, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has a sprawling growth habit, often forming dense mats on the ground, and features narrow, linear leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Diplotaxis vinealis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
